message: I've long thought an IRL group centered around ruby & js open source hacking would be swell. Maybe The Changelog would be a good community for this to spring off of.
http://bit.ly/dY9Wo5 ;)
Damn. Thought this was about a drinkup group around the changelog.

@bat Honestly I'm pretty disappointed that the Changelog focuses so strongly on Ruby and JS, as if those were the only two open source languages out there. I'm glad @kennethreitz is there squeezing some Python in between the cracks, at least.
@bitprophet thanks! I try :)
It drives me crazy, seriously

fo sho'. It's not that it has the focus per se, it's the presentation/assumption that that one community "is" open source. Same reason people assuming that Github === open source is annoying; sure, it may be the best community code host by far, but implying that if you're not on github you're not doing open source, is just silly

Same reason Ruby folks often seem to think that the dynamic features shared by Python and Ruby and similar languages are Ruby's only. I had to correct ruby-lang.org because they thought you couldn't modify Python classes after definition, for example :(
@kennethreitz if you guys ever need to get a contact for something like go, or other google OSS stuff, I can ask around to see if someone can chat with you guys.
sorry for the disappoint :p
also, non-github is okay. we're branching out.
i try to get non-ruby stuff in there. i got some C in today ;)
im just better connected with the ruby community
just at first, its easier to focus on something specific and then move outward, you know?
@steveklabnik yeah man, I loved the inception post. pure awesome-sauce
:) I was so psyched when I saw it.

@bitprophet If it's heavy on Ruby and JS, it's because we write what we know as authors and I probably post the most. Time for @kennethreitz to step up his game. So much great Python (and a ton of other stuff out there) that we'd love to cover.
Only so many hours in a day :)
@kennethreitz true, that's why there are nights :)
ie: I think the general populace should know more about Go (which is like node.js, but with some things that are more awesome, some that are not).
@pengwynn Realizing that you folks are only two guys... do you have a method for people to submit news / articles for inclusion?
There are four of us ;)
@justinlilly you can email us with submissions at ping@thechangelog.com
@kennethreitz Cool, I'll be sending some Scala gear down the line. :)
@pengwynn don't make me delete that message :)
would love to have some scala. anything is game. even <gasp> php
